bibl.title: Due corone tolemaiche.
bibl.note: The victory of Ptolemy IV Philopator at Raphia in 217 B.C. was celebrated in some stelae with a text written in Greek, in hieroglyphic and in demotic. A representation of the victorious king precedes the text. The most significative attribute is the crown on the head of the king. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Loretta Del Francia Barocas & Mario Cappozzo (edd.), Egitto e mondo antico. Studi per Claudio Barocas = RSO 85 (2012) pp. 213-220.

The victory of Ptolemy IV Philopator at Raphia in 217 B.C. was celebrated in some stelae with a text written in Greek, in hieroglyphic and in demotic. A representation of the victorious king precedes the text. The most significative attribute is the crown on the head of the king. - Avec résumé en anglais.
